sentences.en: ...the very ordered way in which mathematics and geometry describe nature.
sentences.cn: …数学和几何学描述自然的条理性。

sentences.en: By the laws of geometry we can find the displaced joint positions.
sentences.cn: 由几何定律可以求出变形后的节点位置.

sentences.en: His idea was to apply geometry to dynamics.
sentences.cn: 他的想法就是将几何学应用在力学上。

sentences.en: It has developed from two sources : algebraic geometry and algebraic member theory.
sentences.cn: 它由两个方面发展而来,代数几何和代数数论.

sentences.en: Local deviations depend strongly on the local geometry of the solid matrix.
sentences.cn: 局部偏离严格地依赖于固体矩阵的局部几何形状.

sentences.en: Rigour is the concern of philosophy and not of geometry.
sentences.cn: 严密为哲学而不为几何学所关心.

sentences.en: The boy puzzled his way through geometry.
sentences.cn: 那男孩煞费苦心地钻研几何学.

sentences.en: The common conclusion was the uniqueness and necessity of Euclidean geometry.
sentences.cn: 欧几里德几何的唯一性与必要性已被公认.

sentences.en: The component layers have the geometry of stratigraphic units.
sentences.cn: 一分层具有地层单元的几何形态.

sentences.en: The fuller development of the parallelism was to lead to analytic geometry.
sentences.cn: 这种平行性的进一步发扬便导致了解析几何的产生.

sentences.en: the geometry of a spider's web
The Greek concentration on geometry blurred the vision of later generations.
sentences.cn: 希腊人之专注于几何迷糊了后世好几代人的视界.

sentences.en: The non - Euclidena geometries were in effect subordinated to Euclidean geometry.
sentences.cn: 非 欧几里德几何实际上是从属于欧几里德几何的.

sentences.en: The problem is one of geometry, what these slopes and planes mean. "
sentences.cn: 这些斜坡和平面到底意味着什么,这是个几何题. ”

sentences.en: the very ordered way in which mathematics and geometry describe nature
sentences.cn: 数学和几何学描述自然的条理性

sentences.en: Their study is called the intrinsic geometry of the surface.
sentences.cn: 它们的研究被称做曲面的内蕴几何.

words.tran_cn: 几何学的；[数] 几何学图形的
用几何学；几何学上地；按几何级数地
[植保] 尺蠖（一种虫子，行动时身体弯成弧状）；几何学者

phrases.tran_cn: [数]分形几何；碎形几何；不规则碎片几何体
n. 射影几何；投影几何学
转向轮偏转角关系；转向几何图形
可变机翼，可变几何尺寸

trans.tran_cn: 几何学，几何形状，几何图形，几何学著作
trans.tran_en: the study in  mathematics  of the angles and shapes formed by the relationships of lines, surfaces, and solid objects in space
